item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/526]Dice Tower Reviews: 2 de Mayo[/url][/b]

item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/7352]Dice Tower Reviews: 7 Wonders[/url][/b]

item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/762]Dice Tower Reviews: A la carte[/url][/b]

item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/765]Dice Tower Reviews: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac[/url][/b]

item.name: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small
Airlines Europe
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/7548]Dice Tower Reviews: Airlines Europe[/url][/b]

item.name: Aladdin's Dragons
item.comment: Really like the blind bidding aspect. It's amazing how many times I am outbid by just 1, but it makes for great fun! Must play with the magic cards!

item.name: Alhambra: Big Box
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/657]Dice Tower Reviews: Alhambra[/url][/b]

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/3569]Dice Tower Reviews: Alien Frontiers[/url][/b]

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: I can't say that I'm a big fan of the theme, but the game has some incredible mechanics - I especially like the bidding, and wouldn't mind seeing it in more games.

item.name: Animal Upon Animal
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/360850/video-review-animal-upon-animal]Dice Tower Reviews: Animal upon Animal[/url][/b]

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/20922/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Apples to Apples[/url][/b]

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/3136/ascension-chronicle-of-the-godslayer/dice-tower-reviews-ascension]Dice Tower Video Review: Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer[/url][/b]

item.name: Ave Caesar
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/20152/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Ave Caesar[/url][/b]

item.name: Babel
item.comment: Vicious game, but fun. It may just be one of my favorite Kosmos two-player games; but some people would likely be too squeamish for the nasty play.

item.name: Backseat Drawing
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/405256/video-review-backseat-drawing-and-junior-version]Dice Tower Reviews: Backseat Drawing[/url][/b]

item.name: Balderdash
item.comment: I usually rarely play the same party game often, but this one keeps me coming back. After a while, I stop trying to win, and just get plain silly.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/488671/video-review-battle-line]Dice Tower Reviews: Battle Line[/url][/b]

item.name: Battleground
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/392017/video-review-battleground-fantasy-warfare-monste]Dice Tower Reviews: Battleground: Fantasy Warfare[/url][/b]

item.name: Birds, Bugs and Beans
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/25122/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Birds, Bugs and Beans[/url][/b]

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/9849/blood-bowl-team-manager-the-card-game/dice-tower-reviews-blood-bowl-team-manager-the-c]Dice Tower Reviews: Blood Bowl: Team Manager - The Card Game[/url][/b]

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: A very fun tile laying game - works superbly well with only 2 players. Read my review for more details...

item.name: Carcassonne: The City
item.comment: My favorite incarnation of the series yet. See my review for more details...

item.name: Carson City
item.comment: Yes, it's worker placement - but it has confrontation, theft, and a cool theme. Like it very much!

item.name: Castle
item.comment: Very fun - there isn't much hype about this game, but it's one that plays extremely well with 2 players, but is also fun for 5! See my review for more details..

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: Not a bad cooperative game, but more like a beginner's cooperative game.

item.name: Cat & Fish
item.comment: A simple worker placement game - but don't let the "kid look" fool you. It's quite good!

item.name: Catacombs
item.comment: Short and sweet, a good combo of dexterity and dungeon crawling.

item.name: Catch the Match
item.comment: I love this game - I can pull it out anytime, anywhere, and people are interested and play.

item.name: Cloud 9
item.comment: Tremendous filler with poker-like bluffing. See my review for more details...

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: A fun game, surprisingly good for three players...

item.name: Colosseum
item.comment: Amazingly fun, with a good theme and a terrific way of building up to a nice showdown on the last turn. See my review for more details...

item.name: Compatibility
item.comment: An enjoyable party game - if you see it at a thrift store, pick it up. Lots of fun for dating couples or young married folk.

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
The best version yet. Almost as good components as the AH version, and the best - cleanest - easiest to understand timing issue.
Oh, and technology rocks.

item.name: Coyote
item.comment: Great fun - reminds me a bit of Liar's Dice. A very enjoyable party game.

item.name: Crazy Mixed Up Zoo
item.comment: My rating - just above a "5". My kids rate it a "10", so it's somewhere in the middle. See my review for more details...

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment: Cutthroat Caverns may cause some arguments between players, and that coupled with its theme will keep it from being played with some of my gaming groups. But with an adventure loving, easy-going group, this can be one of the most fun experiences I've ever had with a game. I like the fact that players are forced to be cooperative yet can stick the dagger into each other at the most inopportune moment. Shrieks of rage and shock and laughter mingle together in this game from Smirk and Dagger, their best work to date. I highly look forward to the multiple expansions promised, to see what new monsters and rules will be added. For me, one of the best games of 2007. See my review for more details...

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: Mixing auctions and combat shouldn't work, but it does in this thematic, fairly quick, involved hybrid game.

item.name: Dancing Eggs
item.comment: One of the funniest dexterity games I've ever seen. The packaging and rubber eggs are reason enough to snag this one.

item.name: David & Goliath
item.comment: Very interesting card game. Never before have I been so torn between whether I should take a trick or not! See my review for more details...

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: Played a prototype version. Add the awesome artwork and this is going to be one of the most popular cooperative games ever. I'm still amazed at how different all the characters feel.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Diamant
item.comment: How far are you willing to push your luck? A great game for eight players, and I never seem to survive the occasion. Great fun, though!

item.name: Dice Town
item.comment: A tremendously entertaining game. Poker/Yahtzee/Liar's Dice all rolled up into one game. Great theming adds to the fun.

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Better than Lowenherz, but different enough to warrant owning both.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: An amazing game in which you build your deck while using it. Fantastic combos and more have me just salivating to play it. Simple, yet very fun.

item.name: Dragon's Gold
item.comment: I am thrilled to play this game with others who love to barter, trade, and argue. It has a good feel to the negotiating. See my review for more details.

item.name: Duck, Duck, Bruce
item.comment: Duck Duck Bruce is for kids and their parents/teachers/caretakers. It's a fun game that you'll enjoy laughing at and playing, and kids will learn about risk taking. The game is full of simple, fun choices - from deciding how many cards to steal to how many cards to draw. You can play it until you're sick of it - which may happen, but I think you'll have fun before that point. Comical artwork and a funny theme help elevate this kids game to one that will be requested often. And adults won't roll their eyes when it is. See my review for more details...

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment: A fun cooperative game.

item.name: Dweebies
item.comment: Kind of a kid version of a tile-laying game. Good for teaching strategies, and kids will love the art.

item.name: Escape from the Aliens in Outer Space
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Excape
item.comment: More fun than Can't Stop. Strategy counts as much as luck. Okay - maybe not, but at least it feels that way!

item.name: Faces
item.comment: The rating is for my awesome custom version.

item.name: Fairy Tale
item.comment: One of the best fillers ever. Love drafting outside of a CCG! See my review for more details...

item.name: Fantasy Business
item.comment: Another good game in the blue box series. You have to play this with folks with thick skins, as some people lie every turn of the game! Read my review for more details.

item.name: Fist of Dragonstones
item.comment: Fun blind bidding game - see my review for more details.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: An excellent "filler" for up to six players. Quick and fun. See my review for more details...

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: A great cooperative game for children. Very similar to Pandemic, with high quality components and art.

item.name: Forbidden Stars
item.comment: Rating based on the preview play, it may change when the final game is published.

item.name: Funny Fishing
item.comment: A lot more enjoyable than I originally thought. I was prepared for the lines to get all tangled up - but they are good quality and are holding up fine. One of my favorite "kid" games.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: Loads of fun! I don't care if my ship gets blown up, I just have fun building it and seeing if it survives.

item.name: Get Bit!
item.comment: What a fantastic filler! The actual physical nature of ripping off the arms of the robots is hilarious, and there is some really sound strategy involved. One of the best games I played at Origins 2008.

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment: It's crazy hard. But it offers a challenge that I find a lot of fun.

item.name: Grab Bag
item.comment: A simple tactile game in which players must find pieces from a bag. Simple - great for younger kids.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: Probably the most elegant game I've ever played. My favorite Eurogame.

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: Very light, but very fun. The theme just makes us laugh. See my review for more details...

item.name: Havoc: The Hundred Years War
item.comment: No more need to play poker! This game has the elements I like from poker, plus actual strategy (ducks objects thrown by die hard poker players). See my review for more details...

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: Amazing fun. I was blown away at how enjoyable this game was.

item.name: Heave Ho!
item.comment: Fast and fun! What I really enjoy about the game is the unique way in which cards are distributed. Also, the game is very easy to teach, and makes for a quick, pickup game to be played anytime. See my review for more details.

item.name: HeroQuest
item.comment:
Sure, there are better RPGs out there. But this one is a classic, and one that always brings a lot of fun and shouting to a table.
Update: Descent has made this obsolete. Sorry!

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment: Duel of Ages lite. The cool factor is so high, however, that it keeps coming out in my game club, week after week.

item.name: Hippos & Crocodiles
item.comment: Pretty impressive, considering how simple the game is. Fast and fun - I've probably played the game twenty times already.

item.name: Horse Fever
item.comment: See my video for more info...

item.name: Igloo Pop
item.comment: GREAT for kids. GOOD for adults.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment: Chaotic, but great theme, and a lot of fun. Some really unique ideas here - especially splaying.

item.name: Jambo
item.comment: This has the possibility of becoming my favorite of the Kosmos two-player series. The only good two-player trading game I think I have played.

item.name: Jet Set
item.comment: Ticket to Ride on Steroids. I prefer the easier version, frankly. But this version does have an appeal, although it's hard to win if you fall behind.

item.name: Jungle Smart
item.comment: Neat! a fun little deduction logic game.

item.name: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination
Karottenklau
item.comment: I found this game to sound utterly horrible. But it's a cooperative game in which players make simple but interesting decisions - I really think it works for young kids!

item.name: Käseklau!
item.comment: A good push-your-luck game for kids.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: A tremendous gateway game - one of the best of 2007. I love the dice, and how this game shows another way to use them.

item.name: Knuckling Knights
item.comment: I'm far too kind to this game - mostly because it has a dice tower. But it has a dice tower. Extra points!!

item.name: Leapfrog
item.comment: Fascinating - nice components, and intriguing gameplay. See my review for more details...

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Lifeboat
item.comment: If you are looking for a backstabbing negotiation game that only takes an hour and a deck of cards, Lifeboat is a good choice. While not as refined as some other games in the genre, it is one of the more heavily-themed ones; and I enjoyed it quite a bit. It does require five or six players to get the full effect, but the shorter time frame makes it more enjoyable and allows players to get into a fun sort of mean-spiritedness that might grate after a longer period. And being the Psychopath is likely joyless in life but amazingly content as you watch the sharks eat your opponents. You can have the jewels and money; I just want to stay alive. See my review for more details...

item.name: Lifeboats
item.comment: I like the interaction. It might have been fifteen minutes shorter, but it's enjoyable regardless. I still have to make my "public announcement of the fact that we are all friends" before playing, though.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment: Quickly becoming the dexterity game of the year! But maybe too much of a good thing.

item.name: Lords of Vegas
item.comment: An area control game with a lot of interaction, nasty plays, dice, and some randomness. I love it!

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: The best two player game there is - mainly because my wife loves it and asks to play it frequently. See my review for more details.

item.name: Lost Legacy: Binbo Tantei to Inbo no Shiro
Luck of the Draw
item.comment: You don't have to know how to draw to play this game? Sign me up!! A very funny game. See my review for more details...

item.name: Magic: The Gathering – Arena of the Planeswalkers
Mamma Mia!
item.comment: It's a memory game, but the theme and fun factor of it makes it quite fun.

item.name: Los Mampfos
item.comment: Well, the theme is absolutely hilarious - especially to children of any age. And that's the target audience.

item.name: Manhattan
item.comment: My favorite "building" game. See my review for more details.

item.name: Monkey Memory
item.comment: My favorite of this line - my kids and I have a blast playing this game! See my review for more details...

item.name: Monopoly: Tropical Tycoon DVD Game
item.comment: VERY VERY good. I was impressed. Takes a good concept of Monopoly and reworks it into something that's much more enjoyable. Loved it!

item.name: Monza
item.comment: A simple car racing game for kids using logic and colors. My kids really enjoy it.

item.name: My First Carcassonne
item.comment: Good components, good quality, and a lot of fun for children. An excellent package, and more than just "dumbed down" Carcassonne.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: A very enjoyable filler. Sort of like a simple, "push-your-luck", reverse auction. See my review for more details...

item.name: Nobody but Us Chickens
item.comment: An excellent light card game - in a good box! See my review for more details...

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment: The reverse of Scotland Yard. Has the makings of a classic, a lot of fun - tense, entertaining game.

item.name: On the Underground
item.comment: Fantastic game. I love how the passenger moves, and it really looks and feels like a subway map.

item.name: Overpower
item.comment: My personal favorite CCG. It had its flaws - but it was just fun fun fun fun fun!

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: While not as exciting as Shadows over Camelot, I am tickled pink about the cooperative element in this game. It's tough (really tough!), and the mechanics of the virus spreading are tremendous.

item.name: Pentago
item.comment: One of my favorite abstract games. Simple, easy, yet compelling. I love it! Read my review for more details...

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/157057/review-the-pillars-of-the-earth]Dice Tower Reviews: Pillars of the Earth[/url][/b]

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/574/pitchcar/video-review-pitchcar]Dice Tower Reviews: PitchCar[/url][/b]

item.name: Pocket Rockets
item.comment: Quick and fun. Recommended.

item.name: Pop Belly
item.comment: I have to say that this doesn't work as mechanically well as I'd like, but the popping stomachs is a hilarious idea, and everyone has fun with it.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: An excellent game - very mathematical, yet thematic.

item.name: Primordial Soup
item.comment: The pieces alone are nifty, but the idea is fun. People who want to wage "war" can do a little of that, while people who want to avoid others can do that. And everyone likes eating the little blocks...

item.name: The Princess and the Pea
item.comment: It's nice to stack something other than blocks for once. :)

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Great game, but I don't think it's as great as some people say. Still highly recommend it.

item.name: Queen's Necklace
item.comment: See my review for more details.

item.name: Quinamid
item.comment: I highly recommend Quinamid; from the quality components to the simple yet engaging rules, this is one of the best games of 2007 - and easily one of my favorite two-player abstract games. When using the variants, it can become rather deep, yet never so overwhelming as to cause me to dislike it. A two-player game that I can enjoy with my wife, children, or a friend who drops by, Quinamid will likely never leave my collection - an exceptional game. See my review for more details...

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: Well, I'm impressed. Wasn't sure how a two player card space game would work, but this one rocks! Goodbye San Juan!

item.name: Redakai
item.comment: [b][url=http://www.boardgamegeek.com/video/10206/redakai/dice-tower-reviews-redakai]Dice Tower Reviews: Redakai[/url][/b]

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
RoboRally
item.comment: I was amazed at how close the races turned out to be. Must play small, criss-cross races to have fun, though.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: Very simple, yet fun. A game that uses the Yahtzee mechanic but with a completely different feel.

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/26851/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Saint Petersburg[/url][/b]

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/9491/sentinels-of-the-multiverse/dice-tower-reviews-sentinels-of-the-multiverse]Dice Tower Reviews: Sentinels of the Multiverse[/url][/b]

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/67647/review-shadows-over-camelot]Dice Tower Reviews: Shadows over Camelot[/url][/b]

item.name: Shadows over Camelot: The Card Game
Sleeping Queens
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/85226/review-sleeping-queens]Dice Tower Reviews: Sleeping Queens[/url][/b]

item.name: Sleuth
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/24830/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Sleuth[/url][/b]

item.name: Smarty Party!
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/17526/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Smarty Party![/url][/b]

item.name: Socken zocken
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/570/socken-zocken/video-review-socken-zocken]Dice Tower Reviews: Socken Zocken[/url][/b]

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/529/sorry-sliders/video-review-sorry-sliders]Dice Tower Reviews: Sorry! Sliders[/url][/b]

item.name: Spot it!
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/7146/spot-it/dice-tower-reviews-spot-it]Dice Tower Reviews: Spot It![/url][/b]

item.name: Squint
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/6354/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: [/url][/b]

item.name: Star Trek: Fleet Captains
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/9764/star-trek-fleet-captains/miami-dice-023-star-trek-fleet-captains]Dice Tower Reviews - Miami Dice: Star Trek: Fleet Captains[/url][/b]

item.name: Star Wars: The Queen's Gambit
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/6747/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Star Wars: The Queen's Gambit[/url][/b]

item.name: Starship Catan
item.comment: This game isn't as good as Starfarers - that's for sure, but it's an excellent game nonetheless, and one of the best two player games there is.

item.name: Step To It
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/270700/review-step-to-it]Dice Tower Reviews: Step To It[/url][/b]

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: Sort of a simpler version of Pillars of the Earth. It's fast and fun - enjoyable, but not as strategy filled.

item.name: Strong Stuff!
item.comment: A great fun dexterity game. I'm actually competitive in this one with the kids, so I like it!

item.name: Summoner Wars: Master Set
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/8260/summoner-wars-master-set/dice-tower-reviews-summoner-wars-master-set]Dice Tower Reviews: Summoner Wars: Master Set[/url][/b]

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/6462/survive-escape-from-atlantis/dice-tower-reviews-survive]Dice Tower Reviews: Survive: Escape from Atlantis![/url][/b]

item.name: Tales & Games: The Hare & the Tortoise
Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/646/tales-of-the-arabian-nights/video-review-tales-of-arabian-nights]Dice Tower Reviews: Tales of the Arabian Nights[/url][/b]

item.name: Telestrations
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/3611/telestrations/dice-tower-reviews-telestrations]Dice Tower Reviews: Telestrations[/url][/b]

item.name: The Bottle Imp
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/26165/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: The Bottle Imp[/url][/b]

item.name: Three of a Crime
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/195392/review-three-of-a-crime]Dice Tower Reviews: Three of a Crime[/url][/b]

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Märklin
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/106624/review-ticket-to-ride-marklin]Dice Tower Reviews: Ticket to Ride: Märklin Edition[/url][/b]

item.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/484/times-up-title-recall/video-review-times-up-title-recall]Dice Tower Reviews: Time's Up! Title Recall![/url][/b]

item.name: Toss Your Cookies
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/189121/review-toss-your-cookies]Dice Tower Reviews: Toss Your Cookies[/url][/b]

item.name: Traumfabrik
item.comment: GREAT theme - even better with some pasteups. And a decent auction game. Together, a very fun experience.

item.name: Tumblin-Dice
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/823/tumblin-dice/video-review-tumblin-dice]Dice Tower Reviews: Tumblin-Dice[/url][/b]

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: The theme is the game. The game is the theme. Excellent! See my review for more details...

item.name: Uglydoll Card Game
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/108780/review-uglydoll-card-game]Dice Tower Reviews: Uglydoll Card Game[/url][/b]

item.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/video/506/ultimate-werewolf-ultimate-edition/video-review-ultimate-werewolf-ultimate-edition]Dice Tower Reviews: Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition[/url][/b]

item.name: Um Reifenbreite
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/16390/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Um Reifenbreite[/url][/b]

item.name: Vabanque
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/16148/user-review]Dice Tower Reviews: Vagabondo[/url][/b]

item.name: VivaJava: The Coffee Game: The Dice Game
Walk the Dogs
item.comment: [b][url=http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/85108/review-walk-the-dogs]Dice Tower Reviews: Walk the Dogs[/url][/b]

item.name: Walter Wick Can You See What I See?

item.name: Worldbeater
item.comment: A terrific game we played as a child, with very little luck. Setting up the best possible move was quite a bit of fun in this game that was slightly before it's time in game mechanics.
